data: This life we stumble through, or strut through, or through which we creep and whine, or through which we dance and whistle, is built upon hazardâ€”and that is why it is such a very wobbling affair, made up of tricks and chances; hence its miseries, but hence also its spice; hence its tragedies, and hence also its romance.

This life we stumble through, or strut through, or through which we creep and whine, or through which we dance and whistle, is built upon hazard--and that is why it is such a very wobbling affair, made up of tricks and chances; hence its miseries, but hence also its spice; hence its tragedies, and hence also its romance.
Hutchinson, A. S. M. (Arthur Stuart-Menteth), 1880-1971; Meylan, Paul Julian, 1882-1961 [Illustrator]
